title: Error: Callback was already called.

body: Hey @andreafspeziale ! I don't see your actual contract (`UnpackFixed`) imported in your test file.
@CruzMolina Hey, yes because it is a kind of a mock to check that was working. There are any requirements that I'm missing? Should not running anyway?

@CruzMolina By the way I get the same error even:
- Importing MyContract.sol
- Calling the file TestMyContract.sol
- Calling the contract TestMyContract.sol

Hmm, testing this locally, I seem to be able to run your commands successfully ðŸ¤”.

If you comment out the `development` network does your test run?
From where? From the config? If yes it wont even start. If u mean turn off my ganache and the config and let truffle do it fail in the same way. By the way you can find me on gitter to speed it up.
Ok we fixed this specific issue simply by removing the `build` folder.

Same issue happening. The provided solution (remove build folder) does not help.
I am surprised that the issue is closed despite the fact that it is not resolved, actually.
@unboxedtype can you please provide additional reproduction steps?

Magic steps :)

1) `truffle unbox metacoin`

2) Create `contracts/Foo.sol`:
```solidity
pragma solidity ^0.5;

contract Bar {}
```

3) `truffle test test/TestMetaCoin.sol`

I'm also having this issue and could reproduce steps above. Removing build folder did nothing.

I've found that testing a contract that does not have any functions to test does not result in the error.

Thanks for the repro steps @canercidam! I think this was closed because there was a bug fix for an error with similar symptoms. We probably thought this was the same problem when closing it.

I was able to reproduce your error and I'll investigate this week!

Bug was probably introduced in 5.0.31. 5.0.30 works for me on Linux.
5.1.0 is still affected.
